bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CURTIS:H.R. 7271.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, of the Constitution[Page H10170]

item.title: Public-Private Partnership Advisory Council to End Human Trafficking Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

summary.text:
Public-Private Partnership Advisory Council to End Human Trafficking Act

This bill establishes the Public-Private Partnership Advisory Council to End Human Trafficking.

It sets forth functions of the council, including to review federal policy and programs to combat human trafficking.

bill.title: Public-Private Partnership Advisory Council to End Human Trafficking Act

item.title: Public-Private Partnership Advisory Council to End Human Trafficking Act
To establish the Public-Private Partnership Advisory Council to End Human Trafficking, and for other purposes.
Public-Private Partnership Advisory Council to End Human Trafficking Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
